description: Deep neural network based polyadenylation site analysis.
name: DeepPASTA

metadata.abstract: © 2019 The Author(s). All rights reserved.Alternative polyadenylation (polyA) sites near the 3′ end of a pre-mRNA create multiple mRNA transcripts with different 3′ untranslated regions (3′ UTRs). The sequence elements of a 3′ UTR are essential for many biological activities such as mRNA stability, sub-cellular localization, protein translation, protein binding and translation efficiency. Moreover, numerous studies in the literature have reported the correlation between diseases and the shortening (or lengthening) of 3′ UTRs. As alternative polyA sites are common in mammalian genes, several machine learning agents have been published for predicting polyA sites from sequence data. These agents either consider limited sequence features or use relatively old algorithms for polyA site prediction. Moreover, none of the previous agents consider RNA secondary structures as a feature to predict polyA sites. Results: In this paper, we propose a new deep learning model, called DeepPASTA, for predicting polyA sites from both sequence and RNA secondary structure data. The model is then extended to predict tissue-specific polyA sites. Moreover, the agent can predict the most dominant (i.e. frequently used) polyA site of a gene in a specific tissue and relative dominance when two polyA sites of the same gene are given. Our extensive experiments demonstrate that DeepPASTA signisficantly outperforms the existing agents for polyA site prediction and tissue-specific relative and absolute dominant polyA site prediction.
metadata.title: DeepPASTA: Deep neural network based polyadenylation site analysis
